characters: ON THE FAT COP AND LISA
ON THE BALCONY ACROSS THE STREET
ON THE STREET BALCONY ACROSS THE STREET

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SMASH INTO: A 90's college party in full swing. We find F BLACK GIRLS pushing and shoving their way to the dance fl

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That no matter where you are or what you’re doing, pulls you out your seat. That was me and my crew: The Flossy Posse. The Flossy Posse tear it down with dance that’s all their own. No guys. Just them. PARTY-GOERS stare and point, but these girls don’t give a shit.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I know. Trust me: what you swore was fly back in the day probably wasn’t either. But those were -- and still are -- my girls, thinking we were the baddest chicks in the game...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graduation Day. Our girls take photos in their caps and gowns, which have been bedazzled with ‘FLOSSY POSSE’ logo

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Definitely the baddest chicks at Spelman. After college, we were with each other through everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SASHA shows off her byline on the cover of Time Magazine. other ladies toast.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Successes...  Official White 6-15-16 2. INT. PLANNED PARENTHOOD - DAY —- FLASHBACK 4 Sasha, Ryan and Lisa sit in the waiting room -- ominous S posters are on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mistakes... Dina bursts out of the door of the doctor’s office giddy, arms in the air, signalling victory.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: It’s chlamydia! I got the shit you can cure! They all cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN, gorgeous in her wedding gown, says her vows to STEW in a story-book perfect wedding ceremony.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Weddings... The girls wear bridesmaids gowns and necklaces shaped lik “FP.” They all dab their eyes as Ryan and Stewart kiss. EXT. LISA’S HOUSE - DAY - FLASHBACK 6 Lisa's baby shower. The Flossy Posse watch a very pregnan Lisa opens gifts. Her man looks disinterested as he drink beer in the background. Lisa clocks it, but plays it off.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Babies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies wait, somber. Lisa exits the courtroom, wiping away tears. They embrace her and walk out.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Divorces... We were ride or die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Flossy Posse at Essence Fest over the years with a Ch indicating each passing year.  10 Official White 6-15-16 3.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But sometimes, words go unsaid. Disagreements go unresolved. You still talk on the phone, keep up on social media, but a year goes by where you don’t see each other. That year turns into five. Life doesn’t feel right without them. And that’s when you realize the Flossy Posse needs to ride again. We end on the last Essence photo, dated 2012 and CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RYAN PIERCE, 30s, beautiful, poised, and perfectly put together, strikes poses as a Photographer snaps pictures a FEMALE PRINT REPORTER interviews her.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Relationships take work. Our biggest challenge as women is finding the balance of marriage, career, kids, life in general --

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PRINT REPORTER
dialogues.text: I agree!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We’re told we have to choose between the personal and the professional. But I never believed that. I control my own destiny. I am strong, I am powerful, I am beautiful. If I will it, I can have it all.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PRINT REPORTER
dialogues.text: And it appears you do. Reveal Ryan’s handsome husband STEWART PIERCE, 30s, her e in every way. He steps in with a loving embrace for his w

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DJ is in mid-interview with Ryan and Stewart.

dialogues.speaker: DJ
dialogues.text: Stewart, how does a former all-pro tight-end link up with the second coming of Oprah?  11 Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Ryan’s strength has always been making others their best selves. I knew I needed that in my life. (looking at her) So, I pursued her and I got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He sure did. Everyone laughs. She looks at him with love.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No. I’d say we both did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A national news show -- Ryan and Stewart are being interviewed by TAMRON HALL.

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON
dialogues.text: So Ryan, how did he propose?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: With barbecue.

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON
dialogues.text: (surprised) Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: It was this little hole in the wall spot off campus with some serious pulled pork. Our favorite spot when we didn’t have any money.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He told me he didn’t know where his football career would take him, but that it wouldn’t mean anything if I wasn’t along for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON HALL
dialogues.text: Wow. Tell us -- what is the secret to making this marriage work?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: That's easy. I married my best friend. Ryan is my equal. My partner. 11  12 Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: He told me -- and I'll never forget -- he wanted me to soar as high as I could. On Tamron’s face, swooning as she gestures to their book: “You Can Have It All”. A photo of Stewart kissing Ryan’s cheek is the cover.

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON HALL
dialogues.text: And soar you have. A best-selling author for the second time. Now for our viewers at home, you can purchase Ryan’s latest New York Times best seller, “You Can Have It All,” online or catch them on tour-- what’s your next stop?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: New Orleans. We’ll be signing copies down at Essence Fest.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: And Ryan will be giving this year’s keynote address. That alone is worth the trip. Guaranteed17

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON HALL
dialogues.text: Speaking of having it all -- when are you two starting a family? You’d make such beautiful babies and be fantastic parents.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Trust me, Tamron, it’s on the agenda. Ryan smiles at Stewart. He winks back. It’s adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on Ryan and Stewart’s smiling faces on a flat scree Journalism awards adorn the walls. Reveal SASHA FRANKLIN, 30's, whip smart and in charge. Her desk is covered in pa 12 due bills. She watches the Ryan and Stewart interview on laptop and TMZ on another, phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You don’t have anything for me? Not even some Nicki Minaj or Kardashian foolishness?  Official White 6-15-16 6. Another PHONE rings. She knocks over the framed photo of holding up her Time Magazine cover as she reaches for it.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I’1l1 call you back. (then; into second phone) Bill, hey... I know why you’re calling. She puts the call on speaker.

dialogues.speaker: ADVERTISING REP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We're pulling our ads unless you up your views, Sasha. On her laptop we see her blog -- SASHA’S SECRETS. A headl reading STEVE HARVEY -- ILLITERATE OR JUST IGNORANT? is a a PHOTO of STEVE HARVEY looking confounded as he reads hi note cards at the Miss USA pageant. She scrolls through the site as we see gossip tidbits abo black celebs, none of them flattering.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I have it on the DL that Drake is smashing Oprah. It’s not something that I can publish right now... Sasha knows she’s bullshitting and so does the Ad Rep.

dialogues.speaker: ADVERTISING REP, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: Unless you have proof -- we can’t spend any more money on a dying gossip blog, Sasha.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I can’t invent scandal, but I’m going to Essence Fest this weekend. Someone’s bound to do something crazy.

dialogues.speaker: ADVERTISING REP, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Increase views by the end of the weekend or we pull out.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Come on, Bill. Don’t be premature! The line goes dead. Sasha hangs up, frustrated. Out the corner of her eye, she sees her BMW being hooked up to a truck outside.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: No! No, no, no, no!!!  13 Official White 6-15-16 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An out of breath Sasha runs up to a gross, sweaty TOW TRU DRIVER, hooking up her car to his truck.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: That’s my car!

dialogues.speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Not anymore, bae bae.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Dude, come on, I need my car!

dialogues.speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Yeah, I feel you, but the bank ‘needs’ their money. Sooo, you know. The Tow Truck Driver continues hooking up Sasha’s car. Sa is desperate.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: What if we could work something out? You look like a man who appreciates a woman with curves.

dialogues.speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Oh, I do... If you let me tie you up, strip you down, and then take a shit on your titties, I’m one hundred percent in.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (stunned) Who thinks that? Let alone says it. Fuck that, your nasty ass is out of control. I'll take Uber.

dialogues.speaker: TOW TRUCK DRIVER
dialogues.text: Suit your self. Good luck gettin your whip back, bae-bae. He hops in his truck. As he drives off, Sasha screams--

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Wait, what if I whip out a titty? Will you settle for a titty?! Sasha watches, frustrated, as he pulls off with her car. YEAR-OLD BOY rides by on his bike, stopping.

dialogues.speaker: 12-YEAR-OLD BOY
dialogues.text: Whatever you're selling? I’m buyin.  14 Official White 6-15-16 8. INT. TOTAL PAPER - TED’S OFFICE - DAY 14 DINA, 30s, hot tempered and always looking for a cause to fight (justified or not), sits across from her boss, TED, 50s, stern-faced and full of disappointment.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dina, throwing staplers at co- workers is not only frowned upon here at Total Paper, it’s also illegal. It’s a form of assault.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: That's why I aimed for his lower body and not his face.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Not the point. You're lucky Vikram decided not to press charges.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: And he’s lucky I aimed low. So we're both lucky. All good.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: (sighing) Dina, I’m going to have to let you go. For everyone’s safety. I hope you understand. Dina shrugs this off. She does not understand.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Totally. Won’t happen again. We’re all cool.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dina, listen to me. We’re not all cool. I’m letting you go.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I feel you, Big Ted. It’s water under the bridge. Gonna get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dina. There’s no bridge and you should not get back to work. Now, please acknowledge you understand that you're fired.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Ted, I get it. You’re upset. I shouldn't thrown things in a... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 Official White 6-15-16 9.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (using air quotes) “place of work”.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Why are you making air quotes? This is a place of work. Dina stands.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Lesson learned. By the way? I’m going to Essence Fest with my girls this weekend. So I’m gonna need Friday off.

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dina, you can have all the days off. You're fired. As in you don’t have a job. Do you understand me?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Yep, see you bright and early Tuesday. So glad we did this, Ted. I feel like this is progress. Dina exits. A banged-up Vikram spots her in the hallway a runs in the other direction. Flustered, Ted calls after h

dialogues.speaker: TED
dialogues.text: Dina! Don’t make me call security!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LISA COOPER, 30s, Type A, no nonsense, wearing nurse’s scrubs, reviews a very detailed list.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Here’s their schedule: bath time, snack time, homework time, ten minutes of TV, bed time. DELORES, 60s, watches Family Feud, barely listening to Li

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: Steve Harvey could get it on the Lord's day. While I was at church.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Mom! Focus!

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: Will you calm down?! I have raised kids before. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 6-15-16 10.

dialogues.speaker: DELORES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (then, re: Lisa) Although not without their issues.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You know what? Forget it. I’m staying. I can’t take a chance on them deviating from their bed time. Before Delores can protest in walks Dina, shades and Mard Gras beads on, blasting Lil Wayne from her phone.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: How'd you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Fuck a locked door. You ready to get turnt?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I can’t go. There’s just too much going on --

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Nope. Nope. Nope.

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: For once I agree with Dina. Delores calls out into the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: Austin! Riley! Come say goodbye to your Mom! She’s going off to have fun so she won’t be so grouchy all the time. Lisa gives her mom a look as AUSTIN, 6, and RILEY, 4, run Lisa kneels down, pulls them into a tight, dramatic hug.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Do not let Meemaw let you stay up late. And do not forget how much I love you.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Bitch, you ain’t going off to war. Dina grabs Lisa’s bag and walks out. Lisa still hugs them

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: Go! I beg you! We'll be fine. Lisa reluctantly releases them, starts toward the door. D waits on the porch.  Official White 6-15-16 11.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Are you seriously wearing scrubs? You got on granny panties too? (looking at her feet) Oh, shit! Clogs?? Is that your new birth control?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Stewart gather their belongings. Their agent, ELIZABETH DAVELLI, 40s, crude and ballsy as hell, walks i

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: As usual, you guys fucking killed it! And I’m not the only one who thought so...

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Are you going to tell us who else thought so?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Jesus, you have no patience for dramatic revelations, do you? Fine. Bethany Marshall, the head of marketing at Calmart thought so! And... Ryan hangs on her words. Excited.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Just tell us!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: They want to launch an exclusive “Ryan and Stewart” collection and underwrite a “Ryan and Stewart” talk show. Ryan screams, hugging Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (stunned) That's -- amazing!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: She said, and I quote, “They’re just so real.” She and her biz affairs team are flying down to New Orleans this weekend to make the (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 6-15-16 12.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: offer. They want to launch the line by the end of the year-- Ryan looks at Stewart, over the moon.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Stewart, this is --

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: -- Incredible! Everything we’ve talked about. He kisses her lovingly. Then checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn -- better head out if I’m going to make my flight. I’1l catch you and the ladies later.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes, you will!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Bye, big guy. Elizabeth hugs Stewart. A little too long. It’s awkward, you can’t blame her. He exudes sexuality and manliness. As he goes, Elizabeth looks at Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Don’t hate me, but -- are you sure you still want to have a wild weekend with your girls, when so much is hanging on the line? Can't you just close the deal and take them to St. Bart’s next month? Buy them all Birkin bags?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Elizabeth, it’ll be fine -- we’re all adults. Our wild days are behind us. Most of us...

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: You’re sure? Because if I went to New Orleans for a weekend with my college friends, there'd be pictures of our tits all over the internet. If I’m being honest, there's a few of those already, but YOUR tits are best-selling author tits...  17 Official White 6-15-16 13.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What’s the title of my book, Elizabeth?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (rotely) “You Can Have It All”.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Fine -- I trust your judgement. And I can’t wait to meet “The Flossy Posse.” You guys are going to be keekee-ing all weekend. Girl, bye.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Liz -- and I say this out of love -- do yourself a favor this weekend and refrain from saying “sistas”, “bye, Felicia”, “ratchet” or any other urban colloquialisms you may think are appropriate. They’re not.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (beat) Wow. I’m not even offended. That’s why you are Ryan-fucking-Pierce and you're going to be RICH. Go have your hashtag Black Girl Magic weekend. PS. Which one’s Felicia? Ryan shakes her head, smiling, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: (calling after) Am I allowed to say “hello” to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Dina sit at the gate as Lisa digs through her KNAPSACK.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I’ve got us covered for the plane ride: anti-nausea medication, hand- santizer, hazmat masks, earplugs. Only have one blanket though. You know how many germs are in an airline blanket? Dina frowns at her scrubs.  Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Aren’t nurses supposed to be sexy? Fishnets and cleavage and sponge baths and whatnot?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Yes, in porn. Not in the real world. This might be why you have trouble keeping a job.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I stay employed, Judge Judy. Lisa pops an anti-nausea pill and puts her mask in place.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You need to relax. I got some bomb ass cush if you wanna take a hit before we board. Shit will get you right.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Wait, how did you-- actually, nevermind, I don’t want to know.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Good, ‘cause I ain’t telling. But I'll give you a hint: where the sun don’t shine.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Definite pass then. You think there will be any drama with Ryan and Sasha. It’s been long enough, right?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Better be. I came here to get white girl wasted. I’m not letting any of you bitches kill my vibe. A smiling Ryan rolls up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me... can you ladies point me to the “Flossy Posse”?

dialogues.speaker: LISA DINA
dialogues.text: Ryan! My nigga. Ryan gives Lisa and Dina big hugs.  Official White 6-15-16 15.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I’m so happy to see you two!!

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey ladies! They all turn to see Sasha roll up, expensive outfit. The picture of confidence and success. Sasha hugs Lisa and Di full of love and excitement.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I’ve missed you guys! They pull apart. Sasha turns to Ryan. An awkward beat. Th they hug, the barely touching kind.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Look at you, girl! Life is treating you well.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Please. I see you and Stew pop up on my feed once a week going to some fabulous event. Lisa and Dina pick up on the “nice-nasty” vibe.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (sotto) This isn’t weird, right?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: (sotto) Shiiit. These bitches plastic. Lisa pulls out four bedazzled Flossy Posse vests from her to break the tension.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay, check it out. I made these just for the occasion! The vests look like something old ladies in Atlantic City would wear to keep track of each other in the casino.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Bitch, I thought I told you to push that sewing machine off your roof.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What? They’re fashionable...

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: ...in a Kanye sorta way, sure.  18 Official White 6-15-16 16.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How ‘bout we save them for the last night?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Or the flight home?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Or this recycle bin over here.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You know what? Y’all don’t deserve them... The girls laugh. Lisa pouts, puts the vests away. As they her in good fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our ladies sit in first class, which is all black except a terrified ELDERLY WHITE COUPLE, 70's.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WHITE WOMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t understand. I thought this was first class. Sasha, sits next to a masked and blanket covered Lisa spr her arms with insect repellent. Sasha gives her a look.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I'm just saying. We all have to be mindful. When that Zika swarm hits you want to prepared.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Don’t make me trade seats.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You want half my sandwich?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You still vegan?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Then no. A FLIGHT ATTENDANT tends to Ryan and Dina.  Ryan nods, Official White 6-15-16 17.

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: What can I get you, Ms Pierce?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Vodka tonic, splash of cranberry.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oh shit, I see you Ryan! Getting the party started! This shit is free, right? embarrassed. Dina snaps her fingers, excited.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Heyyy. In that case, let me holler at three whiskey shots and a coke to chase that shit. Coke zero, though, I’m watching my figure. Actually, do you have Cherry Coke?

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Ma’am, you know this flight is only an hour, right?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Good lookin’ out. So let me get those three shots now. Then hit me with a shot of Bailey’s when we reach our cruising altitude... The Flight Attendant scurries off.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And don’t forget my Cherry Coke!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dina, can we turn it down a notch?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Girl, please. We about to descend on the Crescent City to celebrate Black womanhood in all its forms. From the elegant to the ratchet. (she gets up) Who here going to Essence fest?! Nearly all of the plane affirms.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WHITE WOMAN
dialogues.text: We are not. Her husband, slightly deaf, is confused.  Official White 6-15-16 18.

dialogues.speaker: ELDERLY WHITE MAN
dialogues.text: Are we being hijacked?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Ladies, we ain’t turning down shit!! Am I right? The plane full of women affirms it. Sasha laughs. Dina’s crazy but that’s their girl.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Dina! Sit down! Dina grabs the tray of shots from the FLIGHT ATTENDANT

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Ma’ am-—

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: It’s alright, girl. I got this. Get us some more Patron shots next. I got everyone in here. The Flight Attendant is miffed but goes back. Dina passes shots to Sasha, Lisa and the rest plane singing “I’m Ever Woman.” The rest of the plane joins in. Ryan exchanges smiles with Sasha and Lisa who sing and cl along. Sasha whips out her selfie stick.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Alright, ladies! On three... Sasha counts down as the girls lean in and snap their fir trip pic. Right then Lisa projectile vomits.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Told you to get that kush. A brass band version of Bill Withers’ “Lovely Day” drops kicking off a MONTAGE of photos and handheld video:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plane lands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies rolling through the airport with their LUGGAGE Essence signage and a JAZZ BAND greet them.  21 22 23 24 Official White 6-15-16 19.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: The Flossy Posse is back, N’Awlins! A LIMO DRIVER with an Ipad that says “FLOSSY POSSE” on it greets them as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Baby, you can get Hurricanes anywhere. But I’m the only place in New Orleans you can get this... He pulls out a shiny bottle of ABSINTHE. Dina’s eyes ligh like a kid. He’s got her.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: The fuck is that?

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: It’s two hundred year old pure wormwood absinthe. Green Fairy.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I want it!  59 Official White 6-15-16 58. Excited, Dina reaches for the bottle, but he pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: I just want to make sure you know what you're getting--

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I don’t give a fuck. That shit is green and shiny and looks like it will get us hella bent!

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: It will. A tiny splash will have you seeing in 3-D. Dina stares at the bottle, transfixed, not listening.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Just a splash, got it? Any more than that--

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Nigga, just give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: This bottle should probably last you four or five years--

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Yep, got it. Five weeks.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: No. Five years.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Five days. Understood.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: I feel like you’re not listening. This has hallucinogenic properties-- Dina hands over some cash, grabs the bottle, cuts him off

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Thank you. This will be used very ignorantly. As Dina walks away, the Vendor shakes his head, knowingly

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “THE ESSENCE OF COOKING” banner hangs above Ryan and Stew as they cook in a mock kitchen in front of a few hundred  Official White 6-15-16 59. FANS. BETHANY, 40s, the conservative Calmart exec, sits i the front row next to Elizabeth, beaming.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: And now Stew is going to add rice so it can get coated with all that savory flavor.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: And keep stirring so it doesn’t get burned.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Can’t have that, y’all. They laugh together as everyone in the audience enjoys th wonder couple.

dialogues.speaker: ON SASHA/LISA/DINA
dialogues.text: The ladies sit in the crowd watching Ryan and Stewart.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Ryan is on some Academy Award shit right now for that performance.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s not all put on. I think she still really loves him and there’s nothing wrong with that.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You think we gonna get to taste what they making? I love jambalaya.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: You two look like you're having so much fun! I guess that chapter in your book is right: “The Couple Who Cooks Together Stays Together”. Everyone applauds as Ryan catches a glimpse of Simone in audience! Her demeanor shifts.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So true. You see Shaun, when cooking it is vital to remain faithful to the recipe so it can turn out right. The shared experience should bring you closer because you’re invested in the (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: final result. Isn’t that right, honey?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Sure is. Ryan is very neat, orderly and follows the recipe to the t-

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: And Stewart is a messy cook. Doesn't clean after himself and improvs. A lot.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (sensing a shift) Well, there is no one way to be in the kitchen. Sometimes you want to switch it up, sometimes a little extra spice give you a little kick and maybe surprises you. Ryan grunts a sarcastic utterance. Then--

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: (shouting) That’s what I’m talking about. Lisa, Dina and Sasha see Simone as does Stewart.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: No, this bitch didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Now this meal comes with some fresh jalapeno cornbread. . .

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No Shaun! No bread. No side dishes! Shaun is taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One pot meals like this have everything you need for a hearty, savory, meal. But some folks just aren't satisfied. I say put it ina bowl and keep it moving.

dialogues.speaker: ON BETHANY AND ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Elizabeth doesn’t know what’s going on as Bethany laughs. 60.  Official White 6-15-16 61.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: Oh wow, she is a hoot.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Ha. Yeah. That’s my girl. (sotto) What the fuck--?

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Why don’t we invite a lucky audience member to come and sample?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Great idea. Simone is up out of her chair and heads toward the stage. ladies notice and leap into action.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oh hell no...

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Let’s go... The ladies and Simone scurry, converging toward the stage

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Looks like we have a few hungry volunteers.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Who the fuck are these chicks? Ryan silently fumes as Simone approaches and gets a sampl from a VOLUNTEER. Lisa cuts her off and takes it instead.

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry. I just wanted a taste.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I think you’ve tasted enough. Ryan made this meal with Stew. Not you.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: (tasting it) For real. And it’s good than a motherfucker. Ryan you can cook!

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: It’s really good, but I’d really love more sausage in mine.  Official White 6-15-16 62.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (maintaining composure) Really? How about it Stew: you gonna give her some more sausage?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (throat clear) Well, the customer is always right.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh. Apparently there’s an abundance of sausage to go around. Stewart just loves to dole it out---

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (intervening) Ryan. Just how much sausage should be added?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: When it comes to sausage it all depends on how greedy you want to be before stuffing it in your bowl. Ryan grabs a MEAT CLEAVER swinging it dangerously close t Stewart who has to weave out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can chop it. . Whack whack whack goes the cleaver into the sausage.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can slice it sideways--- Ryan slices with a CHEF’S KNIFE splitting the sausage in half, then methodically slicing it in little pieces.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can even grind it. Ryan grabs two sausages, tosses them in a meat grinder an goes to work making mincemeat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: Isn’t sausage ground up already?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes, but one might choke on chunky bits of sausage. Ryan tosses a bowl of jambalaya with extra sausage to Sim  Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: Only if you have a gag-reflex.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oooh, this bitch gonna get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: Are they still talking about jambalaya?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Yeah. It’s colloquial: “put your foot in it”, “so good make ya wanna slap ya mamma” “bitch gonna get hurt” Same etymology.

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN ROBINSON
dialogues.text: This ladies and gentlemen this may be the epitome of too many cooks in the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: Thanks for the sample. I'll be sure to try it again. Simone saunters off. Ryan calls after her.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You should move on from this one--

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (cutting) Uhhh because there’s plenty of more delicious food ...

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Out here at Essence eats .. .

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: So get your own, ho!

dialogues.speaker: SHAUN
dialogues.text: And that is the Essence of Cooking! 63. APPLAUSE from the audience. Lisa/Sasha/Dina/Ryan and Stew all bow. Bethany beams.  Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Stewart walk backstage.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: What the hell was that, Ry?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You're asking me? You were supposed to keep the sausage gobbler in check. What happened to that?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: That was not my fault --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh, so your penis ended up in her mouth how exactly? Because let’s be clear: that’s how this started.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to figure out how to get yourself under control... Elizabeth enters.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: That was fucking amazing! The crowd loved it. Bethany loved it. Were those your girls? I thought there were only three? Who’s the hottie with the badonkadonk?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: She’s nobody. Never seen her before.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Crap. I should get her number --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: No worries. It’s better improvised. Stewart, can I steal you for a minute? There’s a reporter who’s a football fan. He walks off with Elizabeth. Ryan takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I am strong, I am powerful... I am... 64. 60  61 Official White 6-15-16 65. She stops as her eyes mist. The mask is off. She breathes deeply, trying to find inner strength. Sasha walks up.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You good, Ry? Ryan pulls herself together. Turns around, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, girl. All good! That was kinda crazy, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Little bit.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Thanks for having my back up there.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Of course. You sure you’re good?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yup. All in a day’s work. I’ve got a fan meet and greet -- I’1l catch up with y’all later, okay? She walks off, holding it together. Sasha is concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thousands of people walk through the center as sponsors h panels on everything from beauty and style to business to empowerment and music. Celebrities including Tyrese and Morris Chestnut wave to and interact with fans. Dina scre

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oh my God! ‘Rese! Tyrese! Be my baby-boy, puleeeeeezeee!! She goes to pull up her shirt and Lisa stops her.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Dina, I swear to God if don't control yourself...

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I’m just saying I’d leave Diddy for Tyrese. Lisa rolls her eyes. Sasha is busy checking her email on phone. She has an OVERDRAFT NOTICE from her bank and an EVICTION NOTICE from her landlord.  62 63 Official White 6-15-16 66.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: What the hell--?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Yeah... it will be. INT. RITZ CARLTON - GIRLS’ SUITE BAR AREA - AFTERNOON 62 Dina’s behind the bar mixing drinks like a pro, discreetl pouring a generous amount of ABSINTHE in each glass. Musi blasts through the TV’s iTunes connection and iPhotos of Flossy Posse from past Essence Fests rotate on screen.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You’ve got the Crabwalk, the Butter Churner, the Organ Grinder... sometimes they cry during that one.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Why would you want them to cry?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Power.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (popping head in) Can you turn that down? I’m on the phone! Sasha turns down the music. Sasha and Dina exchange looks

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oooh, she need some dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa resumes FaceTime with Riley and Austin.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I've gotta go, we’re gonna go listen to a man sing some songs. Make sure Meemaw puts you to bed now. Ryan walks by and waves to the kids.  Official White 6-15-16 67.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hi guys! Bye guys! (to Lisa) So cute! As Lisa hangs up --

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You and Stewart ever talk about it? Maybe a baby will help bring you closer. Kids change men. Didn’t change Terrence... but hell, maybe you'll get lucky. And no one will ever love you like your babies.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. We talk about it -- I’ve just been so focused on career.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Well don’t wait too long. No one will ever love you like your babies.

dialogues.speaker: DINA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Until they become ungrateful fucking teenagers

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Don’t listen to her. Before Ryan can respond the sound of a door knock is hear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth enters the open door, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Is this the Flossy Posse suite?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Who's asking?

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Ryan’s agent, Elizabeth. Saw you guys at the demo. “That bitch gonna get hurt.” So fun. Ryan walks out of the bedroom, nervous at seeing Dina and Elizabeth in the same proximity.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hey...  Official White 6-15-16 68.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Bethany wants to meet you and Stewart tonight at the White party. I know you’re with the F to the P, just hang out with her for fifteen minutes. Inspire her to add another zero to the deal...

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Y’all cool to hang out at a party for a little bit before we go to the concert?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Who’s Bethany?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: She's the Calmart exec giving me and Stewart our own BRAND.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oh, THAT Bethany! We love that bitch! Let’s make a toast.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Ooh, did you make us hurricanes?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Fuck a hurricane. This is a tsunami.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I was thinking maybe just wine tonight...

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Did you put on your granny panties again? We got drinking to do! Dina hands one to Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Welcome to Saturday night Flossy Posse style... Ryan shoots Elizabeth a look like, “Don’t worry, it’s jus one drink.” Dina raises her glass, as do the others.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: To Bethany. And the shit-ton of money she’s going to give Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: And Stewart...  65 Official White 6-15-16 69.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, that motherfucker, too. Ryan shoots Dina a “shut-up” look as they all down their drinks.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: So, I’ll see you there? And don’t forget we’ve got the signing meeting tomorrow. Let’s be bright- eyed and bushy-tailed. She eyes Dina, worried.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You have my word. Tonight I’m taking it easy.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Dass mah gurrll... They all look at Elizabeth crazy. Then--

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Okay, she’s cut off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super exclusive, VIP Essence-sponsored party. Sasha, Lisa Dina get busy to a NEW HIP-HOP JAM. Sasha looks out into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Is that Pharrell? I can’t tell. Why does he look so blurry? The music changes and the crowd looks like they’re slowin down. The girls start to sway a bit.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I feel a little funny. Do you feel funny?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Feel funny? (feeling herself) I feel fine. See? Feel me? Lisa rubs her.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Why are you feeling her?  66 67 Official White 6-15-16 70.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Because she axed did she feel funny? (giggling) I said axed.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You did. (looking) Oo, baller-alert. Bye, bitches. Dina takes off out of frame.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Is she moving in slow motion or am I hearing in slow motion? Sasha looks up at the stars painted on the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Oh shit -- do not look up! MONTAGE of the ladies tripping: -In Sasha’s POV she’s hurling through space -Dina dances with a model-looking type guy and she is int him, grinding her ass all over his crotch as the camera m to reveal a hideous dude who can’t believe his luck. -Lisa looks toward a myriad of statues of Jazz Musicians suddenly animate and come to life. Lisa is mezmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dina steps up to the bar.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: One grapefruit please. And a knife. She has a devilish look on her face. INT. SWANKY LOUNGE - WOMEN’S ROOM - NIGHT 67 Dina and her “model” go into a a women’s room stall with grapefruit and shut the door while Lisa is in the mirror applying her make-up like a 6-year-old would.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Pretty! Meanwhile, outside the stall--  68 Official White 6-15-16 71. DINA’S “DATE” (0.S.) Damn, girl! Ooooh. That’s some freaky shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Sasha tries to walk through the crowd, despite the fact that all the party-goers look upside down. She finds Lisa now in crazy make-up.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: There’s a bear in here! Plus, I figured out time travel. Dina walks up, bent at a 70 degree angle, clothes now on backwards.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I just burped and a rainbow came out. The rest of the party-goers stare at them, shaking their heads.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What’re they looking at? Dina looks at Sasha, her face is an undulating Mardi Gras mask.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Oh shit how you do that? That's dope... Dina grabs Sasha’s face. Sasha pushes her hands away.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Stop playing! I told you there’s bear in here.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You know what? I think we might be trippin’.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Where’s Ryan?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: She can’t trip in front of Bethany!  69 Official White 6-15-16 72.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARTY
dialogues.text: Ryan, now sweaty and dizzy is in a VIP booth with Stewart Elizabeth and Bethany trying her best to focus.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: I just loved your cooking demo today. The way you two played off of each other was fantastic. So much fun.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We’re all about fun. Funnn Funnn! Ryan starts rubbing ice cubes on her face.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: Are you feeling okay?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I'm just so thirsty -- Ryan takes a sip of water and completely misses her mouth

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Let me get you a napkin. He dabs her forehead with it. Whispering to her --

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: What the hell are you on?!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What?! Nigga chill out -- Bethany is taken aback as is Stewart, but then his attent is caught by --

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Dina walking across the room taking off her clothes.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Why it so damn hot?

dialogues.speaker: ON RYAN
dialogues.text: She looks up at the WAITRESS, who now appears to be Simon but only to Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS
dialogues.text: Can I get you anything?  Official White 6-15-16 73.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: (to Stewart) What the hell she doing here?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: She’s here to take our order.

dialogues.speaker: WAITRESS/SIMONE
dialogues.text: I can come back--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Don’t. You. Dare. The waitress scurries off. Stewart leans into Ryan.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: What the hell’s gotten into you?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: The devil--?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: (to Bethany) So, tell me more about the Calmart philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: Well-- Suddenly, Elizabeth starts laughing hysterically. Ryan tr to step in and address a confused Bethany.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So you were saying, Bethanyyiiii!!! Bethany’s eyes begin to BUG OUT like they’re animated.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh, shit! Elizabeth continues laughing then starts pecking at Stewa shoulder like a chicken. He shrugs her off and she starts doing it to Bethany.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: I’m not sure what’s happening here... Ryan looks around the party. There’s SIMONE. She blinks h eyes. And there she is dancing, then by the bar drinking, a booth eating, chatting on a couch -- everywhere Ryan lo Simone is there.  70 Official White 6-15-16 74.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I need some fresh air. Ryan takes off, leaving Stewart there to cover on the fly

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: My apologies, Bethany. Ryan's been taking a new allergy medicine and it’s had some side effects.

dialogues.speaker: BETHANY
dialogues.text: (referring to Elizabeth) What’s her excuse? Elizabeth is on the ground in fetus position laughing har

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARTY
dialogues.text: Sasha, Dina and Lisa are trying to get to Ryan. But they’ moving in slow motion. Barely covering ground.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: We've gotta save Ry! If we’re trippin, she’s trippin.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I’m not tripping, but I’m feeling niiiiice Ryan spots them.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: We need to leave! Now! The tsunami has hit! The tsunami has hit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the street, the Flossy Posse are all clearly still on absinthe high. Guzzling water from a street vendor. Ryan turns to Dina, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: What the hell did you put in those drinks?!

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Love.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dina, I’m not playing!  71 Official White 6-15-16 75.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: .+.- and a little absinthe. I may have over poured.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: None of y’all saw the bear?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Fuck! Bethany just saw me like this. We need to hide but I’m too fucked up to find the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (like a child) Look! Pretty hair! She points at a booth on the street where someone is sell WIGS and SUNGLASSES. Cash Money's “Bling-Bling”, pours out from the open door ratchet bar next door.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You know Bethany won’t find you in there... Let’s go set it off. Lisa and Sasha look at each other like WIF this bitch tal about, before they follow her. Ryan does the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies burst into the bar -- WIGS AND SUNGLASSES ON. Still amped. Throwback southern hip hop blasts. This crow ratchet as hell. Ryan goes unrecognized.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Booty sweat and Hennessy in the air. We have found our tribe! All of a sudden Q-Tip’s “Vivrant Thing” comes on.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Oh hell yeah. Let’s dance this shit off. The ladies hit the floor, doing their old sorority step dances. The crowd goes wild. The Flossy Posse owns the fl Until... A group of YOUNG CHICKS, 20s, trashy as fuck, answer the call. They bring the noise.  72 Official White 6-15-16 76.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG CHICK
dialogues.text: Y'all might wanna sit down and rest.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Keep talkin, Kesha. The DJ alternates newer and older songs as the crews batt He reaches into his 1997 arsenal and hits them with Maste P’s “Make ‘Em Say Uhhh” and the Flossy Posse brings the h Ryan is having a blast -- no inhibitions. In disguise. Fr Then, Fetty Wap’s “Trap Queen” drops and the Young Chicks tear it up. But the Flossy Posse will not be outdone. “Lo Control” by Missy Elliot comes on and they kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four shot glasses toast. The Flossy Posse is unstoppable. Before they can knock it back-- Simone walking by bumps i Dina. Record scratch moment. Oh shit. Simone pales, realizing who they are. And they recognize

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You know what? Everyone expects me to beat your ass right now -- but I’m all about love tonight. You have hallucinogens to thank for that. Lisa CLOCKS SIMONE IN THE FACE. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Mine wore off. Now it’s on. One of Simone’s Crew goes after Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: DINA

dialogues.text: We can still do this, Ry. No one will know. You don’t have to believe me, but we can make it all work. The deal, all of it. Ryan glares at him in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: It’s not just about the money, Stew! Do you have any idea how much (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 Official White 6-15-16 96.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: you've hurt me? You’ve ruined everything! How can I trust you?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: I know you can’t trust me as your husband anymore. But you can trust me as your business partner. This deal will set us up for life. We can’t do it if we’re apart.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Do you even love me?

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Of course I do, babe. But this is bigger than love. It’s marriage. Ryan stares at him, knowing she’s selling her soul if she stays.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Ryan without Stewart doesn’t have it all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dina, Lisa and Sasha sit in lounge chairs.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I hope she kicked his cheating ass out and tased his dickskin until it smelled like bacon.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Damn, Lis. You were the one talking “work it out” --

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Changed my mind the minute I saw that look on his face. Fuck him and the ho he rode in on.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Amen! Ryan walks up, game face on.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Stew’s figured out a way to handle the Simone situation.  Official White 6-15-16 Their jaws drop.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: So, you're staying with him?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Yes, we both made mistakes. But we've had some good times together.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Did he dickmatize you that quick?!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Dina, he’s my husband. Not some guy in a bathroom stall. I’m not going to just throw everything away. Ryan’s phone RINGS. She ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I get it, Ryan. You're scared. When I left Terrence, I was terrified. I didn’t think I could make it on my own. But I’m figuring it out. You will too. I’1l help.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: So I can live with my mother like you?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Wow. Shots fired.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, but everything I have is dependent on us staying together! My career, my brand -- I can’t do it alone. If I give all this up -- I have nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Bullshit. You don’t need him! The Ryan we met freshman year was already a star way before Stewart sashayed his ass into the picture. And by the way, we all know that proposal story is bullshit. We were there!

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was so drunk he didn’t even remember he proposed until you told him the next day. 97.  Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: He gave you a ring made out of a gum wrapper.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Is there even anything real left with you two?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I don’t expect you to get it. You're all single! You don’t have any clue about how a relationship works! Whoa. This smacks them hard. Silence.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: The only reason I’m single is because there’s no such thing as too many dicks.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You're gonna get herpes with that attitude.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Where the hell do you get off judging our personal lives?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Says the woman who talks shit about people for a living! Way to use that journalism degree --

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Who’s talking shit now? I got advanced degrees, bitch. You the one with the bullshit MRS.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Everybody breathe, dammit! Time the fuck out!

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: (to Ryan) That herpes shit was low. 98. Ryan’s phone RINGS again. She finally answers the call. I Elizabeth. Ryan walks off to talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Hello.  Official White 6-15-16 99. Sasha’s phone begins BLOWING UP with alerts. “Ryan and Stewart Pierce Mistress Scandal.”

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Oh shit... Lisa and Dina look at Sasha, alarmed by her tone.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: What’s wrong? Ryan walks back up, pissed. Going right for Sasha’s throa

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You conniving bitch! Dina jumps in to keep them separated.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Damn! You bitches got strong!

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I didn’t leak it, I swear -- Simone must have.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I saw you all huddled up with her. What’d you sell it to another site to cover your tracks? I know you’re broke. Don’t think I didn’t notice all the tags hanging off your clothes. We all did. Sasha looks guilty that she’s exposed.

dialogues.speaker: LISA/DINA
dialogues.text: Yeah/those aren’t red bottoms/I've done it before

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How much did you get for ruining my life?

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Oh shit. It’s gone viral! #YouCantHaveItAll is trending.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Sash. Whatever you got, I hope it was worth it.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You know what, Ryan? Truth is, I did consider releasing it, but I (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Official White 6-15-16 100.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: didn’t because you mean more to me than money. But you never valued our friendship as much as you value your own success.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: How can you say that? I’ve always been a friend to you!

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: No, you haven’t! I worked my ass off getting our website off the ground. I quit my job at The Times, hired a designer... And what did you do? Left me high and dry! Because you thought you’d have a better chance at fame with Stewart. And NOT ONCE have you apologized!

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: If you had said no, I wouldn’t have! You should’ve spoken up.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You should have never put me in that position in the first place!

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I mean... you could’ve said no.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Dina, nobody asked you--

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Sasha, I don’t think Ryan --

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Just stop. I should’ve known better than to expect you two to back me. In this circle, we all know there’s a queen... and her two worker bees.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Bitch, who you calling a worker bee? Better take that shit back.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: You know why we never hang out at home? Because we don’t like getting banned from restaurants.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: It was The Olive Garden! Who gives a fuck?  92 93 Official White 6-15-16 101.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Okay! Everybody, TIME OUT!

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Lisa! Shut up. We’re not your kids!

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Then stop acting like it! You know what? I don’t need this. I’m going back home where I’m appreciated! Lisa walks off.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Fuck it. Me, too. I’1ll hitchhike if I have to. Better than being around a bunch of phony-ass bitches who forget how to be friends. (to Ryan) You owe me a taser. She leaves. Sasha and Ryan are left standing there.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: You satisfied, Sasha?! You ruined my life and twenty years of friendship. She walks off.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Are all you bitches still on absinthe? I didn’t do anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the Crescent City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dina swirls her straw in a drink. Not drinking it.

dialogues.speaker: BARTENDER
dialogues.text: You want me to make you something else instead? Dina shakes her head-- no cocktail’s going to fix this. The Hobo who flashed his junk to them at the shitty motel enters. Drunk, not recognizing her.  Official White 6-15-16

dialogues.speaker: HOBO
dialogues.text: You got any change?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: You don’t remember me? He squints at her.

dialogues.speaker: HOBO
dialogues.text: You Rochelle?

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m Rochelle. You ready for our date? She pulls out a purple strap-on-head-dildo from her purse The Hobo hesitates for a moment, then --

dialogues.speaker: HOBO
dialogues.text: Where we gonna go? Dina’s had enough.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Freak. Pull up a chair.
94 Lisa sits on a bench FaceTiming with her mom, who's playi Twister with her grand-kids, tangled up like a pretzel.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I need you to get me from the airport-- I’m coming home early.

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: What? I don’t get it. You were having such a good time!

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I know! And now the weekend’s ruined. So I’m coming home.

dialogues.speaker: DELORES
dialogues.text: Lis? Take it from me... We’re lucky if we get one really good friend in this lifetime. You have three. On Lisa contemplating her mother’s words.  95 96 97 98 99 Official White 6-15-16 103. INT. THE RITZ CARLTON - GIRL’S SUITE BAR AREA - DAY 95 Ryan gets dressed for the keynote speech, trying to keep together. The TV’s on in the background.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY WILLIAMS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hot Topics! So this picture of Stewart Pierce slobbing down this Instagram skank has me floored! Who’da thought there was trouble in paradise? Poor Ryan, right? Ryan snatches up the remote, pressing a button. The screensaver comes on. Past Essence Fest photos of the gir pop up on screen. Pictures of them in much happier times. Ryan watches for a beat, then powers it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha stares at her laptop screen.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY WILLIAMS
dialogues.text: ...-Honestly, I don’t know how Ryan’s gonna survive this. Especially as a quote-unquote relationship expert. Sasha turns it off. Andra Day’s “Rise Up” plays as we see a MONTAGE OF THE GI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa watches GROUPS OF FRIENDS laughing and pass her. She sobs and drowns her sorrows by eating BEIGNETS. Finally, pulls out her phone. Texts Dina: “Where are you?”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan and Stewart meet in the elevator, staring straight ahead, no words. Ryan tries to keep her head high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa enters, sees Dina sitting at the bar sharing a pitch of beer with the Hobo.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Now I know you’re as upset as I am.  100 101 102 Official White 6-15-16 104.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I know y'all probably only keep me around for laughs, but I love you bitches and would die for each one of you. Lisa tears up.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: I know you would and that’s why we keep you around. You’re the most fiercely loyal friend we'll ever know and we're lucky to have you. Laughs or not. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: We need to go see Ry’s speech. She's hurting right now and she needs us.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Let’s go --

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: And guess what we’re wearing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha records a video for her blog.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: This morning I decided I no longer want to be part of a process that tears people down in order to profit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan looks flawless despite everything. She rides in sile next to Stewart, who looks equally stylish. The limo stops. Ryan puts her game face on, then exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan flashes her million dollar smile to the crowd like a as REPORTERS and PAPARAZZI surround her and Stewart.  103 104 105 Official White 6-15-16 105.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Ryan, is it true that you’ve already filed for divorce?

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Stewart, how many mistresses do you have? Ryan and Stewart, hand in hand, walk through, poised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa and Dina’s phones PING. They stop to listen to Sasha video post. INT. ESSENCE VENUE - DRESSING ROOM —- DAY 104 Alone, Ryan stares at herself in the mirror, misty-eyed, repeating her mantra for strength. At her lowest point.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I am strong, I am powerful, I am beautiful... She sees a bottle of champagne with a card from Bethany t reads “Congratulations to the woman who ‘has it all’!” Ryan’s phone BUZZES. She picks it up, sees Sasha’s tagged in a post. Ryan listens.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Effective immediately, “Sasha's Secrets” is no more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha crosses the lobby with her bags in town, a plain ou * not trying to floss- and what’s left of her dignity. As * rounds the corner -- Sasha looks up, surprised. Lisa an Dina walks toward her. Wearing their Flossy Posse vests t Lisa made.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: So you was going to drop the mic on your blog and jet?

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Though it might’ve been best that way.  Official White 6-15-16 106.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (hugging her) You thought wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Look, y’all. I know it might be hard to believe, but I didn’t do it.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: We know. She hands Sasha her Flossy Posse vest.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: I just want to go back to the way things were...

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Shit, we all do! You find me a time machine where we can all live in the same dorm eating Top Ramen and Mad Dog 20/20 for dinner, I’m there... But we’re grown-ass women now and we got to make this shit work, so buckle up, bitch. We’re not letting you out.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (putting on the vest) Damn! Look at you! All giving pep talks -- Lisa looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Shit! Ryan’s speech. We gotta move! It starts in twenty minutes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elizabeth walks Ryan and Stewart through the plan.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Here’s our strategy: deny, deny, deny. It’s a doctored photo. We could spin it as a TMZ/National Enquirer hoax. Say you refused an interview and they were being vindictive. Bottom line, they’re assholes, you’re golden. Ryan nods, breathes in, trying to pull herself together.  107 108 109 Official White 6-15-16 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gridlock. Cars are honking. Drivers yelling. Horses crapp The ladies survey the traffic, panicking.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: We're not going to make it! Sasha pulls cash from her wallet and hands it to the driv

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Yes, we are. We’re just going to have to do it on foot.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: I’m not running in this heat.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA/LISA
dialogues.text: Dina, let’s go! Dina sighs, then climbs out, pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies run. Pooping out after two blocks.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: (breathless) Fuck, we're old. They see NEW ORLEANS’ signature mode of transpo: A PEDI-B riding by.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Hey! Wait up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sasha and Lisa in the canopy. We reveal Dina straddling t driver's lap as he looks over her shoulder to navigate.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Step on it, man! Stop bullshitting! He pumps his legs harder.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Yes, yasssss. Slower, baby. Slower.  Official White 6-15-16 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every seat is filled. Julian sits down in the back. Ryan Stewart walk out hand in hand. Ryan surveys the crowd for girls. They’re not there. Ryan sighs, disappointed, as Stewart walks on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pedicab weaves in and out traffic as the ladies draw nearer to the convention center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They climb out the cab and run through throngs of people push inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very composed Stewart begins speaking into the mic.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: It’s my honor and privilege to introduce this year’s Essence Keynote Speaker. Together, we've weathered many storms and overcome some of the toughest challenges. (then) Please welcome my rock, the woman I’m proud to call my wife... Ryan Pierce! The crowd cheers as Ryan walks on stage. Stewart plants a kiss on her cheek, then takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Thank you, Stew, for that wonderful introduction. Thank you Essence for the honor of speaking today. And last but not least, thank you all for coming out to support me... Ryan reads Elizabeth’s prepared statement from a Teleprompter.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As most of you know, there’ve been many questions about the status of my marriage. And I'd like to put those rumors to rest... The picture that surfaced this morning isn’t (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 114 Official White 6-15-16 109.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: real. All allegations of infidelity are false. My husband and I are in a loving, faithful marriage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies, sweaty and out of breath, run down the hall. Sasha spots the main auditorium doors. They’re closed.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Oh no, it’s already started... Dina reaches for the handle. A VOLUNTEER halts them.

dialogues.speaker: VOLUNTEER
dialogues.text: Sorry, ladies. No late entries. Lisa and Sasha look to Dina, knowingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a loud BANG the back doors open abruptly as Dina kic them in, the ladies tumble inside, causing a scene.

dialogues.speaker: VOLUNTEER, (0.C.)
dialogues.text: I’m calling security! I said step back, fool! Ryan stops. EVERYONE turns and looks toward the commotion Dina straightens her clothing. Lisa smiles politely.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Please... Continue. Ryan smiles, taking in the sight of her girls. She looks the audience, sees VARIOUS WOMEN she’s encountered over t weekend. Women who look up to her. Ryan tries to continue

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: In fact, my husband and I are stronger than ever... Ryan pauses for a long beat. Her emotions catching up.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: (sotto) Come on, Ry... The crowd waits. Ryan wrestles with her conscience. Then looks at her girls, her support system, the Flossy Posse.  Official White 6-15-16 110.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My agent wrote a very convincing statement for me to read to you. And I really thought I could go through with it... because I’ve done a really great job of pretending so many times before. But sometimes you reach a point when you just can’t anymore. And I can’t. I’m tired of all the lies... Stewart looks nervous as hell. He stands, trying to stop

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Ry, let’s take a minute here--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stewart, sit down. Please.

dialogues.speaker: STEWART
dialogues.text: Ryan, baby. Be careful--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Sit your ass down. Now. (to the audience) The picture is real. My husband is having an affair. When I found out, I felt a lot of things: Anger. Heartache. Betrayal. But mostly, fear. Fear that my marriage was ending and that I would be alone. And I was terrified of that... So terrified I was willing to stay with someone who betrayed my trust. So terrified I was willing to accept being treated as less than I am... Stewart hangs his head. Humiliated. People are shocked.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I know that I’m not alone in this. I know a lot of us stay in bad relationships because we've convinced ourselves that being disrespected is better than being alone. But we shouldn’t fear being alone. Because there’s power in re- discovering our own voice. Julian, in the audience, smiles.  Official White 6-15-16 111.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'd forgotten that. I forgot that years before I was Stewart’s wife, I was Ryan. A woman with her own ambitions. Her own dreams. She makes eye contact with Sasha, Lisa and Dina.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But luckily, my girls reminded me of that... reminded me of my own worth. And that there was a time when I didn’t fear anything. Their eyes well with pride.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one has the power to shatter your dreams unless you give it to them. And I refuse to give anyone that power again. Ryan looks out at her fans in the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If anything, I hope that me revealing my truth inspires you to realize your own. Thank you for listening. Ryan makes a swift exit, fighting off tears. As the door closes, an ERUPTION OF APPLAUSE. Stewart sits there, stun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three ladies rush in. Ryan looks at them, says genuin

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry, I didn’t mean any of what I said earlier. I was just--

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: We know. We’re so proud of you, Ry. That was beautiful... Really brave.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: (fighting back tears) You my nigga for real. Sasha hangs back, tries to find the right words.  Official White 6-15-16 112.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Ryan, I would never hurt you, you have to --

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I believe you. Sasha smiles, breathes a huge sigh of relief.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: Yes! Now hug it out! Sasha rolls her eyes at Lisa, then pulls Ryan into a hug. Then Elizabeth walks in. Ryan looks at her apologetically

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Liz, don’t hate me, I--

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: Bethany still wants to do the deal--

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: But how--

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH
dialogues.text: With just you. Ryan takes this in, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: ELIZABETH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Turns out single women are an even bigger market.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Seriously?! Ecstatic, Ryan hugs Elizabeth.

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: Well y'all know what that means... it’s a celebration, bitches! Dina pops the champagne bottle. The ladies all cheer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ladies watch Mariah Carey sing “Fly Like a Bird.” Swa to the music. Having fun.

dialogues.speaker: LISA
dialogues.text: You okay? Ryan shakes her head. Decides to keep it real.  Official White 6-15-16 113.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Not yet. But I will be. Sasha whips out her selfie stick.

dialogues.speaker: SASHA
dialogues.text: Selfie time!

dialogues.speaker: DINA
dialogues.text: This bitch... The ladies all gather and pose for an iconic selfie. A FR FRAME captures it and dates it 2017. On Ryan, finding strength in this moment with her girls.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: In the end, I had to redefine what “having it all” really means...

dialogues.speaker: SUPER
dialogues.text: Tamron Hall sits across from Ryan, mid-interview.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: ...so often, we’ve used that phrase to describe a woman who has a relationship and a successful career. I used to define it that way, too, but I’ve since evolved.

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON HALL
dialogues.text: What does it mean to you now?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: Having it all means having people in your life who elevate you. INT. LISA’S HOUSE - DAY 119 Lisa is on a date. Confidence restored.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Friends who are nurturing... Lisa gets a call from her kids and we see the wallpaper o her phone is the photo of our ladies at Essence Fest.  120 121 122 Official White 6-15-16 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Club PATRONS laugh, drink and have a good time. Dina walk around, checking on the CIROC GIRLS. Running the show. Sh sees Diddy across the club and gives him a nod.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...who are fearless. Dina pulls out her Essence Fest Photo on her smart phone admires it. INT. RYAN AND SASHA’S OFFICE - DAY 121 Empty office. Boxes everywhere. Sasha hangs up a framed, blown up VARIETY article that reads: “OWN picks up Ryan Pierce and Sasha Franklin’s Women’s Empowerment series.”

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...who share your goal to contribute to the world... Sasha sets the Essence Fest photo prominently on her desk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ryan sits, thoughtful and introspective.

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: ..-Having it all means surrounding yourself with people who love and support you. And who won’t let you be afraid to go after the life you want.

dialogues.speaker: TAMRON HALL
dialogues.text: Well put. But I do have to ask, now that the divorce is final, are you dating anyone special?

dialogues.speaker: RYAN
dialogues.text: I learned my lesson the first time-- I’m not talking about my love life! I will say this though, I’m the happiest I’ve been in a long time. She gives a genuine smile as we CUT TO: In the Convention Center Audience we see Julian waits all smiles.  123 124 Official White 6-15-16 115.

dialogues.speaker: CONVENTION CENTER
dialogues.text: Ryan approaches Julian standing with Sasha, Dina and Lisa

dialogues.speaker: RYAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So... how was I?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: You’re still the shit. He kisses her as Lisa, Sasha and Dina walk up together.

dialogues.speaker: LISA/SASHA/DINA
dialogues.text: There she is!/Bring it in, girl/You one brilliant bitch! As they hug, we know the Flossy Posse will always ride. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: CREDITS ROLL OVER
dialogues.text: The Pinettes, an all-female brass band leads a second lin march and our ladies down Bourbon Street as they play a b band version of I’m Every Woman
